column1:
7.1.3.4	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for radical and partial nephrectomy techniques

Offer active surveillance (AS) or thermal ablation (TA) to frail and/or comorbid patients with 
small renal masses.
Perform a percutaneous renal mass biopsy prior to, and not concomitantly with, TA.

When TA or AS are offered, discuss with patients about the harms/benefits with regards to 
oncological outcomes and complications.
Do not routinely offer TA for tumours > 3 cm and cryoablation for tumours > 4 cm.
